channel.title: BBC News - Africa
channel.description: The latest stories from the Africa section of the BBC News web site.
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Pistorius police evidence challenged
item.description: Sprinter Oscar Pistorius's lawyers challenge a detective who told a bail hearing that the athlete deliberately shot his girlfriend Reeva Steenkamp.

item.title: Kenya's chief justice 'threatened'
item.description: Kenya's chief justice says he was threatened in a "poison-pen letter" should presidential candidate Uhuru Kenyatta be barred from contesting March's poll.

item.title: Strike shuts down Malawi's airports
item.description: Malawi's airports are shut because of a civil servants' wage strike, the biggest since Joyce Banda became president last year, leaving passengers stranded.

item.title: Zambia seizes Chinese-owned mine
item.description: The Zambian government takes over the running of a troubled Chinese-owned coal mine after revoking its licence because of safety lapses.

item.title: Crowdfunders win African app prize
item.description: SliceBiz, a Ghana-based service which seeks to popularise crowdfunded investment in Africa, is among the latest Apps4Africa winners.

item.title: France urges Cameroon evacuation
item.description: France urges its citizens to leave north Cameroon "as quickly as possible" after seven of its nationals were kidnapped by gunmen on Tuesday.

item.title: Tunisia PM Hamadi Jebali resigns
item.description: Tunisian Prime Minister Hamadi Jebali resigns after failing to form a new government following a political assassination.

item.title: Penis size matters to female moles
item.description: Female Hottentot golden moles, from sub-Saharan Africa, use penis size to gauge the suitability of male partners, scientists discover.

item.title: Ex-President Gbagbo appears at ICC
item.description: Ivorian ex-President Laurent Gbagbo appears at the International Criminal Court at a hearing to decide whether he could stand trial over post-election violence.

item.title: French soldier dies in Mali fighting
item.description: A French soldier is killed in fighting with Islamist rebels in northern Mali, President Francois Hollande says.

item.title: SA's ANC dismisses new opposition
item.description: South Africa's governing African National Congress (ANC) dismisses the launch of a new party by former mining magnate Mamphela Ramphele.

item.title: Nigeria charges Russia 'gun dealers'
item.description: Fifteen Russian sailors are charged in a court in Nigeria's main city, Lagos, with illegally bringing weapons into the country.

item.title: VIDEO: Dining out on 'reject' food
item.description: Approximately 500 diplomats, United Nations officials and environment ministers have been treated to an official dinner, where the food used was Kenyan produce that would have been thrown away for not meeting supermarket appearance standards

item.title: AUDIO: Apps4Africa winners are announced
item.description: The three winners of the latest Apps4Africa competition are announced on the BBC World Service.

item.title: VIDEO: Pistorius 'very much in love'
item.description: Oscar Pistoprius had no intention of killing his girlfriend, and the couple were very much in love, his defence team has told a court in Pretoria.

item.title: VIDEO: Family tribute to Reeva Steenkamp
item.description: The family of Reeva Steenkamp have given brief statements following a private memorial and cremation service in her hometown of Port Elizabeth.

item.title: VIDEO: South Africa's new party leader
item.description: South African anti-apartheid activist Dr Mamphela Ramphele has set out her much-anticipated plans for a new political party whose first order of business would be to call for electoral reform.

item.title: VIDEO: 'I'm closing for the Kenya election'
item.description: Nairobi hairdresser Agnes Warengi on why she is planning to shift stock out of the premises ahead of the election on 4 March.

item.title: VIDEO: Workers shot in SA mine dispute
item.description: At least five miners have been reported shot by security guards at the Anglo American platinum mine in Rustenburg.

item.title: VIDEO: Fear returns to Mali amid clashes
item.description: The military presence has been beefed up in the northern Malian town of Gao following two suicide bomb attacks last week and heavy fighting against Jihadi fighters.

item.title: African viewpoint: Which leaders are Twitter savvy?
item.description: Which African presidents have the most followers?

item.title: African viewpoint: A three-day week for Ghana?
item.description: Should Ghana work a three-day week to allow for funerals?

item.title: An eye clinic with a long vision
item.description: Kenya's female doctors with a vision to make big profits

item.title: Why being a blind music producer helps
item.description: Why being blind helps a Nigerian music producer

item.title: Is satellite TV killing African football?
item.description: Why a Nigerian prefers Manchester to Katsina United

item.title: Viewpoint: How tribalism stunts African democracy
item.description: How tribalism stunts African democracy

item.title: In pictures: Why Malians now love France
item.description: Mali welcome French moves to oust Islamist militants

item.title: In pictures: Voices from Diabaly after Mali rebel battle
item.description: Mali townspeople on coming face-to-face with Islamist rebels

item.title: Your pictures: On the road in Africa
item.description: Photographs sent in by BBC News website readers of life on the roads in Africa.

item.title: In pictures: Sand mining in Sierra Leone
item.description: Images of Sierra Leone's pristine beaches under threat

item.title: In pictures: Focus on Africa in 2012
item.description: Beach holidays and historic moments in focus

item.title: The amazing wildlife of Africa
item.description: Close encounters from the heart of Africa

item.title: In pictures: Ben Ali riches sold
item.description: Tunisia auctions off ousted leader Ben Ali's riches
